thread.title: Sergio Aguero will stay and fight for Man City place despite emergence of Gabriel Jesus
thread.title_full: Sergio Aguero will stay and fight for Man City place despite emergence of Gabriel Jesus

author: James Ducker
title: Sergio Aguero will stay and fight for Man City place despite emergence of Gabriel Jesus
text:
Sergio Aguero will stay and fight for Man City place despite emergence of Gabriel Jesus Sergio Aguero was only a substitute for Manchester City at West Ham Credit: AFP James Ducker 2 February 2017 • 10:30pm 
S ergio Aguero is determined to stay at Manchester City and fight for his place, despite the threat provided by new signing Gabriel Jesus. 
Aguero was dropped for the third time this season on Wednesday night when Pep Guardiola opted to start with Jesus upfront in t he emphatic 4-0 win away to West Ham United . 
Jesus, 19, scored on his first Premier League start and formed an impressive attacking triumvirate with Leroy Sane and Raheem Sterling, whom Guardiola heralded this week as the club’s future. 
But Aguero, who signed a one-year extension to his contract last year that ties him to City until June 2020 and is the third highest scorer in their history with 154 goals, is confident he still has a lot to offer and has no desire to leave the Etihad Stadium. 
Guardiola said on Wednesday that Aguero “knows and everyone knows we cannot succeed without his contributions” but the manager recently expressed concern about the forward’s dwindling impact in big games. Only two of Aguero’s past 39 goals in the league have come against top six sides. Gabriel Jesus was outstanding for City on Wednesday night 
R eports in some quarters have suggested Guardiola could listen to offers for Aguero this summer, when a glut of new arrivals are expected. But with doubts over the futures of so many players and a flurry of departures in the offing, there are concerns about the risks of too much overhaul in the squad. 
Claudio Bravo was also dropped for the West Ham game. The Chile goalkeeper has struggled to convince since moving to City from Barcelona last summer, but while Guardiola is in the market for another goalkeeper with Willy Caballero out of contract at the end of the season, it remains to be seen if the manager opts to bring in a new No. 1 or an another understudy for Bravo.
